7f0270fd-7d45-43ec-b77e-0038115bb845.explanation (cot):
A mother is Hbs Ag positive and anti Hbe Ag positive. 
            So she is a chronic carrier of Hep. B. 
            Now, risk of transmission of Hep. B in child depends on whether mother is spontaneous carrier or not. 
            If mother is spontaneous carrier, then risk of transmission is 20%. 
            But in this case, mother is anti Hbe Ag positive. 
            So, she is not a spontaneous carrier. 
            So, risk of transmission is 50%.
